issue.title: gamewith.jp

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body: I’m using the tiny shield script with a custom filter, but since it’s AdGuard for iOS, does that mean it has no effect?

issue.title: mobile.x.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://mobile.x.com/i/status/1858899697147986315](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmobile.x.com%2Fi%2Fstatus%2F1858899697147986315) ### Comment > This issue concerns the promotion of X’s mobile app appearing when opening a post in a browser. > > I’ve confirmed reproduction on iOS Safari and Windows Chrome (with the user agent set to iPhone). > Considering the possibility of geographical dependency, I tested with IP addresses from the US, Norway, Japan, Germany, and Israel, and confirmed it reproduces. > > > > In attempting to reproduce this issue using an iPhone, I took care with the following matters: > I cleared Safari’s cache. > I ensured no extensions other than AdGuard were enabled. > I powered off the iPhone and then restarted it. > In Safari settings, I disabled all content blockers and then re-enabled them. > After that, I restarted Safari. > I also restarted AdGuard, and checked for filter updates in AdGuard. During the filter update, I kept the AdGuard window open for two minutes. > ### Screenshots

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/213522#issuecomment-3322037200
>Recently setup AdGuard Home for network wide Ad Blocking; but it's not blocking ads on sites like YouTube like they AdGuard For Mac does.
>
>I've manually added all the same Block Lists that are in AdGuard for Mac, into AdGuard Home

Ads on YouTube are loaded from the same domain as other content, so unfortunately it cannot be blocked on DNS level.
Please use AdGuard extension or app.

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/213522#issuecomment-3326137341
>AdGuard for Safari is no longer blocking ads on YouTube.

Please try to update filters.

> Я установила последнюю версию AdGuard , после чего реклама появилась везде, не только в почте

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body: Hm, I see that the rule helps on your end, but I can't reproduce it. Have you done [the following](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214162#issuecomment-3333745729)? Please also try to install [tinyShield](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214162#issue-3453394666).

! Title: AdGuard Annoyances filter
! Version: 2.2.44.23
! TimeUpdated: 2025-09-29T05:08:02+00:00

in SECTION: Subscriptions - Regular rules
@35806
`dw.com##.content-area .render-container:has(> .dw-widget > [src^="/webapi/iframes/widget/"])`

proposed edit: `dw.com##.content-area .render-container:has(> .dw-widget > [data-cmp-vendor="c44391"])`

There are two targets for: `.content-area .render-container:has(> .dw-widget > [src^="/webapi/iframes/widget/"])`  
Second one is the intended Subscription box.  
But first one hides a widget, graph, which is a part of the article content.

also a map widget on page (after clicking "Show more posts"): https://www.dw.com/en/moldova-ruling-pro-eu-party-wins-election/live-74163154

Note, in both *useful* cases, there is this attribute with the same value: `[data-cmp-vendor="c43449"]`  
while the Subscription annoyance box has (on two article pages I checked) `[data-cmp-vendor="c44391"]`




### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
>Ok I think I know what causes it. Using NordVPN might be the issue here. Then it stays until I clear cookies. I'm not sure if it's compatibility issue with NordVPN or perhaps another A/B testing on YouTube, but I'm still not able to reproduce it (even with NordVPN). When you are connected to NordVPN, please check if you see that `local.adguard.org` is loaded correctly. You can check it in DevTools network panel (it should looks like on the screenshot below).
Screenshot
If it's loaded correctly, then please reproduce ads and show what you see when you run following command: ```js console.log('Request:', Request, '\nJSON.stringify:', JSON.stringify, '\nTextEncoder.prototype.encode:', TextEncoder.prototype.encode); ``` in browser console. It should looks like on the screenshot below.
Screenshot

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.1.6 to 16.2.1
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.1.6 to 16.2.1.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.2.1

Patch Changes

  • #1664 8277b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - The built-in TypeScript types have been updated to more closely match the implementation. Notably, the list of staged files supplied to task functions is readonly string[] and can't be mutated. Thanks @​outslept!

    export default {
---  "*": (files: string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
+++  "*": (files: readonly string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
}

  • #1654 70b9af3 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version has been published from GitHub Actions using Trusted Publishing for npm packages.

  • #1659 4996817 Thanks @​iiroj! - Fix searching configuration files when the working directory is a subdirectory of a git repository, and there are package.json files in the working directory. This situation might happen when running lint-staged for a single package in a monorepo.

  • #1654 7021f0a Thanks @​iiroj! - Return the caret semver range (^) to direct dependencies so that future patch and minor versions are allowed. This enables projects to better maintain and deduplicate their own transitive dependencies while not requiring direct updates to lint-staged. This was changed in 16.2.0 after the vulnerability issues with chalk and debug, which were also removed in the same version.

    Given the recent vulnerabilities in the npm ecosystem, it's best to be very careful when updating dependencies.

v16.2.0

Minor Changes

  • #1615 99eb742 Thanks @​iiroj! - Added a new option --fail-on-changes to make lint-staged exit with code 1 when tasks modify any files, making the precommit hook fail. This is similar to the git diff --exit-code option. Using this flag also implies the --no-revert flag which means any changes made by tasks will be left in the working tree after failing, so that they can be manually staged and the commit tried again.

  • #1611 cd05fd3 Thanks @​rlorenzo! - Added a new option --continue-on-error so that lint-staged will run all tasks to completion even if some of them fail. By default, lint-staded will exit early on the first failure.

  • #1637 82fcc07 Thanks @​iiroj! - Internal lint-staged errors are now thrown and visible in the console output. Previously they were caught with the process exit code set to 1, but not logged. This happens when, for example, there's a syntax error in the lint-staged configuration file.

  • #1647 a5ecc06 Thanks @​iiroj! - Remove debug as a dependency due to recent malware issue; read more at debug-js/debug#1005. Because of this, the DEBUG environment variable is no longer supported — use the --debug to enable debugging

  • #1636 8db2717 Thanks @​iiroj! - Added a new option --hide-unstaged so that lint-staged will hide all unstaged changes to tracked files before running tasks. The changes will be applied back after running the tasks. Note that the combination of flags --hide-unstaged --no-hide-partially-staged isn't meaningful and behaves the same as just --hide-unstaged.

    Thanks to @​ItsNickBarry for the idea and initial implementation in #1552.

  • #1648 7900b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - Remove lilconfig to reduce reliance on third-party dependencies. It was used to find possible config files outside of those tracked in Git, including from the parent directories. This behavior has been moved directly into lint-staged and should work about the same.

Patch Changes

  • #1633 7f9e485 Thanks @​dependabot! - Bumps listr2 from 9.0.3 to 9.0.4.

  • #1626 99d5a9b Thanks @​iiroj! - Due to recent phishing attacks, for example chalk@5.6.1 was released with malware. To avoid lint-staged's users being at risk the direct dependencies are pinned to exact versions, instead of allowing future patch versions with the caret (^) range.

  • #1588 035bbf2 Thanks @​outslept! - Increase performance by listing staged files and searching for configuration concurrently.

  • #1645 deba3ad Thanks @​iiroj! - Remove chalk as a dependency due to recent malware issue; read more at chalk/chalk#656.

    If you are having trouble with ANSI color codes when using lint-staged, you can try setting either FORCE_COLOR=true or NO_COLOR=true env variables.

Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.2.1

Patch Changes

  • #1664 8277b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - The built-in TypeScript types have been updated to more closely match the implementation. Notably, the list of staged files supplied to task functions is readonly string[] and can't be mutated. Thanks @​outslept!

    export default {
---  "*": (files: string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
+++  "*": (files: readonly string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
}

  • #1654 70b9af3 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version has been published from GitHub Actions using Trusted Publishing for npm packages.

  • #1659 4996817 Thanks @​iiroj! - Fix searching configuration files when the working directory is a subdirectory of a git repository, and there are package.json files in the working directory. This situation might happen when running lint-staged for a single package in a monorepo.

  • #1654 7021f0a Thanks @​iiroj! - Return the caret semver range (^) to direct dependencies so that future patch and minor versions are allowed. This enables projects to better maintain and deduplicate their own transitive dependencies while not requiring direct updates to lint-staged. This was changed in 16.2.0 after the vulnerability issues with chalk and debug, which were also removed in the same version.

    Given the recent vulnerabilities in the npm ecosystem, it's best to be very careful when updating dependencies.

16.2.0

Minor Changes

  • #1615 99eb742 Thanks @​iiroj! - Added a new option --fail-on-changes to make lint-staged exit with code 1 when tasks modify any files, making the precommit hook fail. This is similar to the git diff --exit-code option. Using this flag also implies the --no-revert flag which means any changes made by tasks will be left in the working tree after failing, so that they can be manually staged and the commit tried again.

  • #1611 cd05fd3 Thanks @​rlorenzo! - Added a new option --continue-on-error so that lint-staged will run all tasks to completion even if some of them fail. By default, lint-staded will exit early on the first failure.

  • #1637 82fcc07 Thanks @​iiroj! - Internal lint-staged errors are now thrown and visible in the console output. Previously they were caught with the process exit code set to 1, but not logged. This happens when, for example, there's a syntax error in the lint-staged configuration file.

  • #1647 a5ecc06 Thanks @​iiroj! - Remove debug as a dependency due to recent malware issue; read more at debug-js/debug#1005. Because of this, the DEBUG environment variable is no longer supported — use the --debug to enable debugging

  • #1636 8db2717 Thanks @​iiroj! - Added a new option --hide-unstaged so that lint-staged will hide all unstaged changes to tracked files before running tasks. The changes will be applied back after running the tasks. Note that the combination of flags --hide-unstaged --no-hide-partially-staged isn't meaningful and behaves the same as just --hide-unstaged.

    Thanks to @​ItsNickBarry for the idea and initial implementation in #1552.

  • #1648 7900b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - Remove lilconfig to reduce reliance on third-party dependencies. It was used to find possible config files outside of those tracked in Git, including from the parent directories. This behavior has been moved directly into lint-staged and should work about the same.

Patch Changes

  • #1633 7f9e485 Thanks @​dependabot! - Bumps listr2 from 9.0.3 to 9.0.4.

  • #1626 99d5a9b Thanks @​iiroj! - Due to recent phishing attacks, for example chalk@5.6.1 was released with malware. To avoid lint-staged's users being at risk the direct dependencies are pinned to exact versions, instead of allowing future patch versions with the caret (^) range.

  • #1588 035bbf2 Thanks @​outslept! - Increase performance by listing staged files and searching for configuration concurrently.

  • #1645 deba3ad Thanks @​iiroj! - Remove chalk as a dependency due to recent malware issue; read more at chalk/chalk#656.

    If you are having trouble with ANSI color codes when using lint-staged, you can try setting either FORCE_COLOR=true or NO_COLOR=true env variables.

Commits
  • b62e72e chore(changeset): release
  • b320abd docs: add example to changelog
  • e1dd5bb fix: use boolean type for failOnChanges
  • 8277b3b fix: update built-in TypeScript types
  • 6286f31 perf: load each config file only once
  • de970bb fix: remove use of "git restore" because it resets file contents instead of a...
  • 673fdc3 perf: use "git stash" to directly hide unstaged files
  • b111dc8 docs: fix typo in CHANGELOG.md
  • d2b0b73 build(deps-dev): bump @​eslint/js from 9.35.0 to 9.36.0
  • 4996817 fix: always search configuration from both Git and FS
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view
Maintainer changes

This version was pushed to npm by [GitHub Actions](https://www.npmjs.com/~GitHub Actions), a new releaser for lint-staged since your current version.


[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=lint-staged&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=16.1.6&new-version=16.2.1)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

This was changed in 16.2.0 after the vulnerability issues with chalk and debug, which were also removed in the same version.

    Given the recent vulnerabilities in the npm ecosystem, it's best to be very careful when updating dependencies.

16.2.0

Minor Changes

  • #1615 99eb742 Thanks @​iiroj! - Added a new option --fail-on-changes to make lint-staged exit with code 1 when tasks modify any files, making the precommit hook fail. This is similar to the git diff --exit-code option. Using this flag also implies the --no-revert flag which means any changes made by tasks will be left in the working tree after failing, so that they can be manually staged and the commit tried again.

  • #1611 cd05fd3 Thanks @​rlorenzo! - Added a new option --continue-on-error so that lint-staged will run all tasks to completion even if some of them fail. By default, lint-staded will exit early on the first failure.

  • #1637 82fcc07 Thanks @​iiroj! - Internal lint-staged errors are now thrown and visible in the console output. Previously they were caught with the process exit code set to 1, but not logged. This happens when, for example, there's a syntax error in the lint-staged configuration file.

  • #1647 a5ecc06 Thanks @​iiroj! - Remove debug as a dependency due to recent malware issue; read more at debug-js/debug#1005. Because of this, the DEBUG environment variable is no longer supported — use the --debug to enable debugging

  • #1636 8db2717 Thanks @​iiroj! - Added a new option --hide-unstaged so that lint-staged will hide all unstaged changes to tracked files before running tasks. The changes will be applied back after running the tasks. Note that the combination of flags --hide-unstaged --no-hide-partially-staged isn't meaningful and behaves the same as just --hide-unstaged.

    Thanks to @​ItsNickBarry for the idea and initial implementation in #1552.

  • #1648 7900b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - Remove lilconfig to reduce reliance on third-party dependencies. It was used to find possible config files outside of those tracked in Git, including from the parent directories. This behavior has been moved directly into lint-staged and should work about the same.

Patch Changes

  • #1633 7f9e485 Thanks @​dependabot! - Bumps listr2 from 9.0.3 to 9.0.4.

  • #1626 99d5a9b Thanks @​iiroj! - Due to recent phishing attacks, for example chalk@5.6.1 was released with malware. To avoid lint-staged's users being at risk the direct dependencies are pinned to exact versions, instead of allowing future patch versions with the caret (^) range.

  • #1588 035bbf2 Thanks @​outslept! - Increase performance by listing staged files and searching for configuration concurrently.

  • #1645 deba3ad Thanks @​iiroj! - Remove chalk as a dependency due to recent malware issue; read more at chalk/chalk#656.

    If you are having trouble with ANSI color codes when using lint-staged, you can try setting either FORCE_COLOR=true or NO_COLOR=true env variables.

Commits
  • b62e72e chore(changeset): release
  • b320abd docs: add example to changelog
  • e1dd5bb fix: use boolean type for failOnChanges
  • 8277b3b fix: update built-in TypeScript types
  • 6286f31 perf: load each config file only once
  • de970bb fix: remove use of "git restore" because it resets file contents instead of a...
  • 673fdc3 perf: use "git stash" to directly hide unstaged files
  • b111dc8 docs: fix typo in CHANGELOG.md
  • d2b0b73 build(deps-dev): bump @​eslint/js from 9.35.0 to 9.36.0
  • 4996817 fix: always search configuration from both Git and FS
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view
Maintainer changes

This version was pushed to npm by [GitHub Actions](https://www.npmjs.com/~GitHub Actions), a new releaser for lint-staged since your current version.

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.1.6 to 16.2.3
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.1.6 to 16.2.3.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.2.3

Patch Changes

  • #1669 27cd541 Thanks @​iiroj! - When using --fail-on-changes, automatically hidden (partially) unstaged changes are no longer counted to make lint-staged fail.

v16.2.2

Patch Changes

  • #1667 699f95d Thanks @​iiroj! - The backup stash will not be dropped when using --fail-on-changes and there are errors. When reverting to original state is disabled (via --no-revert or --fail-on-changes), hidden (partially) unstaged changes are still restored automatically so that it's easier to resolve the situation manually.

    Additionally, the example for using the backup stash manually now uses the correct backup hash, if available:

    % npx lint-staged --fail-on-changes
✔ Backed up original state in git stash (c18d55a3)
✔ Running tasks for staged files...
✖ Tasks modified files and --fail-on-changes was used!
↓ Cleaning up temporary files...

    ✖ lint-staged failed because --fail-on-changes was used.
    

    Any lost modifications can be restored from a git stash:
    

    > git stash list --format="%h %s"
c18d55a3 On main: lint-staged automatic backup
> git apply --index c18d55a3

v16.2.1

Patch Changes

  • #1664 8277b3b Thanks @​iiroj! - The built-in TypeScript types have been updated to more closely match the implementation. Notably, the list of staged files supplied to task functions is readonly string[] and can't be mutated. Thanks @​outslept!

    export default {
---  "*": (files: string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
+++  "*": (files: readonly string[]) => void console.log('staged files', files)
}

  • #1654 70b9af3 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version has been published from GitHub Actions using Trusted Publishing for npm packages.

  • #1659 4996817 Thanks @​iiroj! - Fix searching configuration files when the working directory is a subdirectory of a git repository, and there are package.json files in the working directory. This situation might happen when running lint-staged for a single package in a monorepo.

  • #1654 7021f0a Thanks @​iiroj! - Return the caret semver range (^) to direct dependencies so that future patch and minor versions are allowed. This enables projects to better maintain and deduplicate their own transitive dependencies while not requiring direct updates to lint-staged. This was changed in 16.2.0 after the vulnerability issues with chalk and debug, which were also removed in the same version.

    Given the recent vulnerabilities in the npm ecosystem, it's best to be very careful when updating dependencies.

v16.2.0

Minor Changes

This enables projects to better maintain and deduplicate their own transitive dependencies while not requiring direct updates to lint-staged.     Given the recent vulnerabilities in the npm ecosystem, it's best to be very careful when updating dependencies.

issue.title: mypharmacy.shoppersdrugmart.ca

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mypharmacy.shoppersdrugmart.ca/en/prescription-dashboard/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmypharmacy.shoppersdrugmart.ca%2Fen%2Fprescription-dashboard%2F) ### Comment > The service will not process the request, returning an error message embedded within the same card shown in provided screenshots stating “something went wrong, your request was not submitted please try again.” > > The entire pharmacy site, not just this prescription refill pop-up card, experiences difficulties with AdGuard engaged. For example, loading the list of prescriptions on file (“we encountered a problem please reload to try again”), or, when using the site/service’s address based search feature to find the pharmacy with my prescriptions on-file: the site will return a correct list of nearby locations but, no matter which I select, the same incorrect location ends up being chosen and displayed on the next screen. > > Shoppers Drug Mart and their parent company are notoriously evil and data hungry. I would not be surprised to learn they’ve set their service up to be as invasive/predatory re: info gathering as possible. That said, this has only occurred after a recent redesign and their prior system/pages for this same prescription process never had an issue with AdGuard before. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/dtt9lyzfc7k88s8ocgskg04cg4k404wr4oo6jbfy2s.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/5ygigemijqkoggoso4s8o8g00kg4gsg249kvjsa9n9.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.12 License type: | free DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Security:
Online Malicious URL Blocklist Other extensions used: | `None `

! Title: AdGuard Annoyances filter
! Version: 2.2.44.23
! TimeUpdated: 2025-09-29T05:08:02+00:00

in SECTION: Subscriptions - Regular rules
@35806
`dw.com##.content-area .render-container:has(> .dw-widget > [src^="/webapi/iframes/widget/"])`

proposed edit: `dw.com##.content-area .render-container:has(> .dw-widget > [data-cmp-vendor="c44391"])`

There are two targets for: `.content-area .render-container:has(> .dw-widget > [src^="/webapi/iframes/widget/"])`  
Second one is the intended Subscription box.  
But first one hides a widget, graph, which is a part of the article content.

also a map widget on page (after clicking "Show more posts"): https://www.dw.com/en/moldova-ruling-pro-eu-party-wins-election/live-74163154

Note, in both *useful* cases, there is this attribute with the same value: `[data-cmp-vendor="c43449"]`  
while the Subscription annoyance box has (on two article pages I checked) `[data-cmp-vendor="c44391"]`




### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 5.1.139 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Brave 1.82.172 based on Chromium: 140.0.7339.207 ### Which device do you use? Desktop (Windows 11 24H2) ### Where is the problem encountered? https://mangalib.org/ru/7523--gwihwanjaui-mabeobeun-teugbyeolhaeya-habnida/read/v3/c125?bid&p=1&ui=466251 ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Peter Lowe's Blocklist ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, Fanboy's Annoyances, Adblock Warning Removal List, EasyList Cookie List, Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List ### Security Online Malicious URL Blocklist, Phishing URL Blocklist, Scam Blocklist by DurableNapkin, uBlock Origin – Badware risks ### DNS filters AdGuard DNS filter ### Language-specific AdGuard Russian filter, RU AdList - Counters ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Send Do-Not-Track signals, Hide your search queries, Self-destruction of third-party cookies ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I haven't closed the window yet, so I can help with something, but if I reload the page, I'm more than sure that this window will disappear. This window, when clicked, takes the user to a semi-promotional site, as if he "won a promo code" and has a limited time to choose it. This window appears very rarely and only on a PC, but it may also appear in the browser version of the site on Android/iOS. Duplicate of #213988 2.

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to enable `EasyList Italy`, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://mobile.x.com/i/status/1858899697147986315](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmobile.x.com%2Fi%2Fstatus%2F1858899697147986315) ### Comment > This issue concerns the promotion of X’s mobile app appearing when opening a post in a browser. > > I’ve confirmed reproduction on iOS Safari and Windows Chrome (with the user agent set to iPhone). > Considering the possibility of geographical dependency, I tested with IP addresses from the US, Norway, Japan, Germany, and Israel, and confirmed it reproduces. > > > > In attempting to reproduce this issue using an iPhone, I took care with the following matters: > I cleared Safari’s cache. > I ensured no extensions other than AdGuard were enabled. > I powered off the iPhone and then restarted it. > In Safari settings, I disabled all content blockers and then re-enabled them. > After that, I restarted Safari. > I also restarted AdGuard, and checked for filter updates in AdGuard.
